item.title: Resources
item.description: Some great resources I’ve used to learn about cybersecurity and practice skills: Hands-On Hacking TryHackMe Hack the Box VulnHub Over the Wire: Wargames Online Courses EdX Basic Network and Database Security Cybrary Youtubers Null Byte Network Chuck Papers NIST Framework News CSO Online Dark Reading Misc. Map of Cybersecurity Domains MITRE ATT&CK

item.title: Study Space Reviews
item.description: Some of my favorite study spots: Interior Highlight Drink High ceilings, simple colors Creative seating Rose Matcha Latte Ogawa Coffee; Milk St, Boston MA Rose matcha latte is sophisticatedly balanced, and the aroma of sprinkled rose petals accompanies every sip. Simple interior, windows stretching from the floor to high ceilings, ample types of seating, and soft classical music in the background.

item.title: Welcome,
item.description: My name is Shannon and I am currently studying cybersecurity at Northeastern University. Here you’ll find a collection of things I’m currently learning, my personal projects, cyber resources I have found useful, and brief reviews of my favorite coffee shops and libraries to study in. Academic Interests Broadly, my current interests lie in: Cyber operational planning Threat analysis Incident response As I further explore different fields within cybersecurity, I anticipate these interests to be refined.
